required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of a New Formulation of Insulin Glargine With Lantus in Patients With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-Month, Multicenter, Randomized, Open-label, Parallel-group Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of a New Formulation of Insulin Glargine and Lantus® Injected in the Morning or Evening in Patients With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus With a 6-month Safety Extension Period

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To compare the efficacy of a new formulation of insulin glargine and Lantus (overall, regardless the injection time) in terms of change of HbA1c from baseline to endpoint (scheduled month 6) in patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus
Secondary Objective:
To compare a new formulation of insulin glargine and Lantus in terms of change in fasting plasma glucose, pre-injection plasma glucose, 8-point self-measured plasma glucose profile

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pre-injection plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint
Change in variability of pre-injection plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint
Proportion (%) of patients with fasting plasma glucose <80 mg/dL
Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint
Change in 8-point self-monitored plasma glucose profiles per time-point from baseline to endpoint
Change in pre-basal insulin injection plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint
Change in daily insulin dose from baseline to endpoint
Change from baseline in treatment satisfaction score using the Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (DTSQs)
Number of Patients with various types of Hypoglycemia Events
